text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with spicy tarragon yogurt chicken
i don't know when it's going to happen
but at some point during the season
you're going to be tired of every single
grilled chicken recipe you have and when
that happens give this a try by the way
that red sauce garnishing is our harissa
sauce we made a while back so that's
going to be the hot sauce used in this
but this will work with any kind of hot
sauce and you can read more about that
on the blog so here we go okay so in a
blender we're going to add a full bunch
of tarragon leaves i just picked them
off the stems tarragon is one of the
most aromatic and sweetest herbs that
there is super good with chicken and
just really really nice in a marinade
like this alright then the star of the
show playing a Greek yogurt any plain
yogurt will work with the Greek yogurt a
little extra special this will also work
with buttermilk by the way and then the
hot stuff I'm using harissa so pretty
much any tomato or pepper based hot
sauces are perfect for this if it's red
or I guess orange and spicy it'll work
in this alright for spice I'm going to
go with some ground cumin some salt and
a couple garlic cloves and that's pretty
much it
and we're going to take that over to the
blender and we're going to blend this
into a paste and I was pulsing on and
off and then I realized hey this is not
working very well something's wrong
why isn't it pureed and then I realized
I forgot the vinegar so you do want a
little bit of acid in here lemon juice
is great any kind of vinegar is great I
decided to use some citrus champagne
vinegar so splash of vinegar and that
was the problem as soon as I added that
and turned it on it blended beautifully
and of course I like to scrape down the
sides as I blend alright so you're going
to liquefy your marinade and you're
going to pour it over chicken now this
will work on pretty much any cut of
chicken I've used this on half chicken's
thighs with bone-in and of course what I
have here boneless skinless chicken
breasts I have a couple particularly
buxom ones right here so we're going to
pour the marinade over we're going to
make sure it's completely coated
thoroughly covered once that happens I
want you to cover that and I want you to
marinate it for just two hours you have
to be careful with marinades that have
yogurt and buttermilk if you go too long
the enzymes and the acid
or something like that actually starts
to cook the chicken and denature the
protein and it may affect the texture in
a way you really don't enjoy so I don't
recommend going overnight all right once
your chicken is marinated for the
appropriate amount of time we're going
to go out to the grill so I did mine
over pretty hot coals about seven
minutes per side but of course that's
going to be up to you if you're
wondering where those two little pieces
of chicken came from that's just the
chicken tenderloin you know that little
chicken filet that's underneath the
breast I just pulled them off when I
grilled it cooks a little more evenly
and as the griller you get a little
snack nobody had any idea it was like
the perfect crime and by the way if the
light looks a little weird there was a
huge rainstorm coming in as soon as I
let the grill so I just barely got this
cooked in time but all's well that ends
well all right so right there mine were
perfect I'm gonna pull those off the
grill I'm gonna head inside I let those
rest a couple minutes while I played it
up my delicious braised lentils have I
done that demo I should do that demo all
right I place my chicken down I garnish
with a little extra harissa or whatever
hot sauce you're using a little sprig of
tarragon just to warn the people what
they're about to eat and that's it spicy
tarragon yogurt chicken super simple and
amazingly flavorful and as if the flavor
fulness was not enough the real benefit
of a yogurt based marinade like this is
the juicy tender awesome chicken can you
see just from that how tender and juicy
that is that was like from the end of
the chicken the driest most overcooked
part and even that piece was spectacular
like I said by the middle of summer you
are so tired of every grilled chicken
recipe you have that you need something
to kind of snap you out of it and this
could be it so I hope you give it a try
head over to food wishes com for all the
ingredient amounts and more information
as usual and as always enjoy
you
